intro: Epilobium pallidiflorum f. laxum, commonly known as the slender-flowered willowherb, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Onagraceae. It is characterized by its slender stems and pale pink to white flowers that bloom in clusters. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. This plant is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. It is a perennial herb that thrives in temperate climates.
